title: Product Specialist
description:
SuiteOp is at the forefront of the hospitality industry, offering an enterprise-grade, vertically-integrated operational system designed to streamline the complexities of managing short-term rentals and hotels. Our platform, which integrates IoT automation, guest portals, staff management, and operations analytics, is built on the vision of enhancing operational efficiency and guest satisfaction through deep connectivity and automation.
Position Overview
As the first Product Specialist at SuiteOp, you will play a foundational role in establishing and growing our customer base. This position is unique, combining responsibilities across sales, customer onboarding, and support. You will be the face of SuiteOp to our customers, guiding them from initial contact through to successful platform adoption and ongoing support. Your role will be critical in understanding customer needs, demonstrating how SuiteOp can meet these needs, and ensuring customers realize the full value of our platform.
Key Responsibilities
Sales Support: Assist in sales processes by providing deep product knowledge and technical expertise. Tailor demonstrations to highlight how SuiteOp addresses specific customer challenges.Customer Onboarding: Lead the onboarding process for new customers, ensuring they are fully trained and comfortable with using all features of SuiteOp’s platform to their advantage.Customer Support: Serve as the primary point of contact for customer support inquiries post-onboarding, troubleshooting issues, and providing timely solutions to ensure customer satisfaction and retention.Feedback Loop: Actively gather and analyze customer feedback, identifying opportunities for product enhancements and collaborating with the product management team to prioritize these improvements.Documentation and Training: Develop comprehensive documentation, training materials, and conduct training sessions to empower customers and internal teams with product knowledge.Market Awareness: Keep abreast of industry trends, competitive landscape, and customer needs to inform SuiteOp’s sales strategy and product development.
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Business, Marketing, Information Technology, Hospitality Management, or a related field.A minimum of 3 years of experience in a role combining elements of sales, customer service, and technical product support, ideally within the SaaS, hospitality, or IoT sectors.Strong technical proficiency with a quick learning ability for complex software platforms.Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, capable of building strong relationships with customers and internal teams.Demonstrated ability to manage the customer lifecycle from sales through onboarding and ongoing support.Proven track record in problem-solving and troubleshooting under pressure.Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple accounts and tasks simultaneously.
Why Join SuiteOp?
By joining SuiteOp, you're not just taking a job; you're becoming a vital part of a team poised to transform the hospitality industry. We offer a competitive salary, comprehensive benefits, and a dynamic work environment where innovation and collaboration are celebrated. As our first Product Specialist, you will have a unique opportunity to shape this role and have a direct impact on our success and the success of our customers.

title: Store Manager
description:
PLEASANT PRAIRIE PREMIUM OUTLETS


WHO WE AREMore than just cookware, Le Creuset has been a colorful companion to meals and memories around the world since 1925. Respect for tradition and authenticity have been Le Creuset’s guiding principal for nearly 100 years – our passion for superior artisanal quality, exceptional design, and European craftsmanship have remained constant.


WHO YOU AREKeeping a Le Creuset store thriving requires a diverse set of skills, and as our Store Manager, you are a master of them all. You play an integral role in the store’s success as the liaison between the customer and company. You work well with all departments, your team is committed to excellence and delivering a joyful customer experience, and you can seamlessly balance a wide array of responsibilities. Our Store Managers are nimble and can multi-task like a pro, leading the team in a dynamic environment. You embody hospitality, charm and professionalism…who could say no to you?


YOUR DAY-TO-DAYBUSINESS OPERATIONSDevelop store business plan to build top line sales, including marketing and promotional strategies that will drive traffic to the store and grow the customer base, with particular emphasis placed on building the local marketRemain current and knowledgeable of industry and local market trends to determine strategic opportunities to maximize sales within the marketEmbrace technology to enhance customer experience; ensure team has working knowledge of all computer and technology systems and softwareEstablish a culture of productivity and accountability through clear expectations, role modeling, and instilling a strong focus on KPI achievementWork closely with cross-functional partners in HR, Planning, and Operations to achieve store/region
BRAND EXPERIENCEDemonstrate sales leadership by taking an active role on the selling floor to promote clientele developmentAct as a brand ambassador reflective of our company values; partners with the Visual Merchandising Manager and District Manager to execute an engaging visual experienceLead and support the store team to elevate every aspect of the store experience through omni channel capabilities, merchandising, and display to create a compelling atmosphereCultivate a warm and welcoming environment by being highly focused on delivering exceptional customer experiences that are engaging, efficient, and personable
LEADERSHIP + TEAM MANAGEMENTBuild a succession plan for engaging and retaining a diverse team to fuel internal growth and mobilityActively recruits and interviews to build an external network of talent to add different perspectives and experience to the teamInspire team through empowerment, creativity, empathy; tailor communication to the individual and leverage their strengthsFoster a collaborative team environment that celebrates achievements while promoting accountability and individual/team contribution
COMMUNICATION + RELATIONSHIPSFoster a culture of strong communication and teamwork to ensure a seamless balance between customer engagement, operational tasks, and visual priorities; stays current and follows through to ensure important company information reaches all levels of the team; link mission, vision, values, goals, and strategies to everyday workEmbrace a culture of development by investing time with direct reports; provide timely and specific employee feedback to create a culture of action and accountability


WHAT WE’RE LOOKING FORManagement experience in a retail/hospitality service environmentProficiency in Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, POS, and laptop/handheld systemsFlexibility to work in various roles based on business needs (i.e., on the sales floor, operations, etc.)Flexibility to work non-traditional hours, including days, nights, weekends, and holidaysHigh School Graduate or equivalentPhysical requirements include ability to be mobile and walking on the sales floor for extended period of time; climb a ladder; lift and carry up to 25 poundsTravel Requirements: This role does not require regular travel; however, this role may need to travel on occasion to meetings, trainings, or to support neighboring stores


EXTRA EXTRASSavviness in leveraging social and business networks to promote brand awarenessAuthentic passion around cooking, baking and entertaining


THE PERKS100% company-paid health benefits (medical, dental, vision, family building coverage, etc.)Monthly and annual bonus opportunities based on store goal achievementVacation + Holiday PayIn-store incentives401k MatchGrowth opportunities: Growth = JoyWork/life balance: No need to show off your juggling skills, we offer the flexibility and the resources to balance bothGenerous employee discount: How much space do you have in your kitchen?
The above information represents typical elements and criteria considered necessary to perform this role successfully. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive list of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this role. Other job-related duties may be assigned by the supervisor.


WHY JOIN US Our mission is simple - to inspire and empower people everywhere to make joy through cooking. Our recipe is equal parts passion, hard work and fun with a culture as vibrant as our products. We constantly stretch ourselves and encourage our associates to do the same. When you join Le Creuset, you become part of a dynamic team that focuses on innovation and collaboration. You are part of something bigger…from your first day to every moment thereafter, you’re going to love what you do!


FLSA STATUS Exempt


EEO STATEMENT Le Creuset is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and associates without regard race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law. All employment decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Le Creuset seeks to recruit, develop, and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills.

title: Chief Operating Officer
description:
Book+Street is seeking a roll-up your sleeves, whatever it takes, get things done, Consulting Operations Manager to work with our clients to streamline processes, manage resources, and optimize project outcomes. Reporting to our Head of COO Solutions, this position is a full-time, salaried, non-exempt position working from our Columbus office and traveling to our clients to get things done onsite. This position will work a minimum of 40 hours per week, with an annual target of 80% Time Worked Billable during our core hours of business, as well as occasional sprints, as needed. This position is eligible for our Hybrid Work policy (minimum 3 days onsite after 90 days).
The ideal candidate will possess a degree in business administration, operations management or a related field, with a master’s degree preferred and will have 10 years of experience as a Chief Operating Officer or similar role, leading operations within a diverse set of industries, and ideally will have experience consulting with early-stage companies to build out their operating systems.
We’re looking for someone with a non-stop positive attitude who loves a challenge, understands and appreciates the sense of urgency required of our diverse startup clients, and excels in a dynamic consulting environment.
You will be aligned with our CORE STRATEGIC VALUES:WIT – You’ll do whatever it takes to ensure our clients’ needs are met!Wisdom – You are always learning, through research and continuing education!The 3Cs – You will communicate, collaborate and cooperate to ensure team and client success!GSDADL – You will thrive on productivity, and get $hit done, all day long!
JOB RESPONSIBILITIESOperational Leadership: Provide strategic direction and leadership for the firm's operational functions, including project management, resource allocation, and process optimization.Strategic Planning: Collaborate with the CEO and executive team to develop and implement strategic plans, initiatives, and goals that align with the firm's vision and objectives.Financial Management: Support financial planning, budgeting, and forecasting to ensure financial health, profitability, and sustainable growth.Resource Allocation: Manage resources such as consultants, technology, and budgetary resources to optimize utilization, productivity, and client satisfaction.Operational Efficiency: Identify areas for process improvement, automation, and best practices implementation to enhance operational efficiency and effectiveness.Cross-functional Collaboration: Work closely with other departments such as sales, marketing, finance, and human resources to coordinate activities, resolve issues, and achieve common objectives. Foster a collaborative and cohesive organizational culture.Client Relationship Management: Work closely with client-facing teams to ensure strong client relationships, exceptional service delivery, and value creation.Risk Management: Identify and mitigate operational risks, proactively addressing challenges to minimize disruptions and ensure project success.Performance Monitoring: Develop and implement performance metrics, KPIs, and reporting mechanisms to track operational performance, analyze data, and drive continuous improvement.Compliance and Governance: Ensure compliance with industry regulations, standards, and best practices, maintaining high levels of integrity, ethics, and corporate governance.Reporting and Analysis: Prepare regular reports and presentations for executive leadership, board of directors, and stakeholders. Provide insights, trends, and recommendations based on data analysis and operational performance metrics.
REQUIREMENTSBachelor's degree in business administration, operations management, or a related field (Master's degree preferred).10+ years of experience in operations leadership with a proven track record of strategic planning, operational excellence, financial management, and team leadership.Strong businessacumen, analytical skills,and decision-making abilities.Excellent communication, negotiation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build relationships and collaborate effectively across all levels of the organization.Proficiency in project management tools, ERP systems,and other relevant software applications.Certification in project management (e.g., PMP) and/or operations management is a plus.Knowledge of industry-specific trends, technologies, and best practices.Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic environment and drive change and innovation initiatives.Experience working with startupsis a big plus.Ability to multitask, prioritize tasks, and work effectively under pressure.Ability to work independently, and within teams, prioritize tasks, and meet targets.Comfortable with using technology, including Mac computers and a variety of software (Hubspot, Monday, Advanced Excel).Excellent ability to communicate professionally with people at all levels of an organization and external contacts, both verbally and in writing – must provide writing samples.Must be available to work from our office or client site 5 days a week for the first 90 days during our core hours of business and occasional evenings, if deadlines require. Hybrid work schedule is only available after 90 days and only when client work allows.Must have reliable transportation and be able to travel for client meetings and events, as needed.Ability to lift approximately 20-25 lbs.
The duties and responsibilities described in this job description may not be a comprehensive list. Additional tasks may be assigned to the employee from time to time and/or the scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands.
COVID-19 VACCINEIn order to maintain a safe work environment, employees will be required to provide proof of vaccination on or before first day of employment.
LOCATIONAt Book+Street® we work in a highly consultive environment – not just with our clients, but among our own team. Selected individual will be expected to work on-site as part of a highly collaborative team in our Victorian Village office and will be able to travel to client sites within the Midwest.
WHY BOOK+STREET?At Book+Street® we love what we do and encourage open communication, flexibility and diversity. We offer a robust benefits package including PTO, paid holidays, sponsored medical, 100% employer paid dental and vision, life, AD&D and disability insurance and a generous 401K match to all full-time employees.
COMPENSATION$120,000-$150,000 per year, plus bonus.
NEXT STEPSTo express your interest, please provide a short cover letter telling us why you’re perfect for this role, along with resume detailing your experience.
Book+Street® is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, religion, gender, age, veteran status, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status or disability (in compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act) with respect to employment opportunities.

title: Environment, Health and Safety Manager
description:
What’s In It For You: We believe that everyone makes a difference and contributes to our overall success. We are a team bound together by pride in our work and dedication to our craft. Our leadership team shares the company’s strategic direction so our workforce can remain informed and attain our internal goals and objectives.  POSITION SUMMARY: This position will be responsible to review, evaluate, and analyze work environments and assist in the design of programs and procedures to control, eliminate, and prevent injury caused by physical, chemical, or ergonomic factors. The position is responsible for managing environmental programs and activities for the facility. The EHS Manager assures compliance with all federal, state, and local environmental regulations by monitoring all regulatory requirements of all environmental permits issued to the facility. 
PRINCIPAL RESPONSIBILITIES: Assess and evaluate plant conditions for compliance, conduct or manage inspections and enforce adherence to laws and regulations governing environment, health and safety. Perform field audits of all personal protective equipment in use in the facility. Ensure completion of routine inspections of safety equipment as required (i.e Emergency eye-washes/showers, fire extinguishers, etc). Work with supervision to develop and implement Job Safety Analysis for each job. Take regular noise level readings in plant areas as required. Inspect and maintain a log of all emergency response equipment and operational status. Assist with reports and statistical analysis of EHS data for corporate review. Conduct ergonomic assessments and implement corrective measures to reduce ergonomic injuries Conduct new-hire employee safety orientation and mandatory EHS trainingLead incident investigations, root cause analysis, and corrective action planning and execution. Provide assistance to the engineering team for new manufacturing process, construction, demolition and renovation activities. Interact with all Federal, State and Local agencies to assure ongoing compliance as well as compliance of any process changes or the addition of new processes to the facility. Update Environmental procedures in line with changing permits and regulations Managing EHS records to ensure proper access and retention of EHS records is maintained  EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED  Bachelor's degree in EHS or related field or equivalent experience 4+ years of experience in EHS within a manufacturing environment Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills Ability to think creatively and strategically to identify and mitigate EHS risks   KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES REQUIRED  Strong knowledge of EHS regulations, standards, and best practices Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills Ability to think creatively and strategically to identify and mitigate EHS risks

title: Personnel Security Specialist

title: Senior Client Manager
description:

This position blends sales acumen, customer service excellence, and strategic negotiation skills to offer comprehensive support to clients striving for financial freedom. title: Sales Director - Portfolio
description:
Req ID: 120687

Remote Position: Yes

Region: Americas

Country: USA

Summary

At Celestica, we are looking for an experienced and driven Sales Director (Individual Contributor) specialized in Data Center and Campus Solutions. This role is designed for a high-performing sales professional who excels in a focused, individual contributor capacity, with a direct responsibility for driving sales and expanding our footprint in the data center and campus solutions market. They will effectively communicate the value proposition of the Celestica HPS products and services, identify customer needs, and provide appropriate solutions. The ideal candidate will possess deep industry knowledge, a robust network of potential clients, and a proven track record of meeting or exceeding sales targets through strategic selling.

Responsibilities

Drives and exceeds revenue and market share in defined target accounts/region.Develops and executes on account strategies in partnership with the business development teamEstablishes long term strategic senior level relationships with customers.Identifies influencers and key decision makers within the account establishing and maintaining close relationships with these stakeholders.Consistent focus on competitive intelligence.Manages customer perceptions and the overall customer relationship process. Consistently identifies potential new opportunities and/or solutions with existing or new customers based on deep understanding of needsParticipates in proposal creation and influence competitive cost targets, trade-offs, and business casesCollaborates with colleagues (executive, leadership and peers) to develop new products and services for customers.Fosters, promotes and facilitates cross-selling of Celestica wide products, services and capabilities.Understands how to leverage big data, cloud to create competitive advantageDeveloping new marketsLeverage external partnerships to augment current capabilities and to enhance value proposition and market competitivenessActs as the customer advocate to ensure that the organization remains customer-focused.Delivers quotations and RFQ responses to customers

Knowledge/Skills/Competencies

Provides high value industry knowledge and consulting to customers on IT technology, architecture, products and services.Specifically positioned to build Celestica’s image as a trusted advisor and promote Celestica value proposition and related roadmap portfolio.Knowledgeable on server, storage and network hardware and software ecosystem vendors.Knowledge and experience in consultative selling to OEMs.Extremely strong communication, interpersonal, relationship management and professional sales skills.Strong reporting skills as well as time and priority management skills.Strong strategic planning and execution skills.Strong team management skills and high level of ability to work with others as part of a cross-functional team.Self-starter who has demonstrated the ability to own, define, develop and execute a sales plan and consistently deliver on quarterly revenue targets.Travel required both domestic and internationally 25%-50% (Position is based in the Bay Area, California).

Physical Demands

Duties of this position are performed in a normal office environment.Duties may require extended periods of sitting and sustained visual concentration on a computer monitor or on numbers and other detailed data.Repetitive manual movements (e.g., data entry, using a computer mouse, using a calculator, etc.) are frequently required.Overnight travel may be required.

Typical Experience

10-15 years of technology related sales or business development experience.5- 7 years of sales experience selling Servers, Storage and Networking products and solutions into OEMs.

Typical Education

Technical degree (BSEE, BS Computer Engineering/Computer Science) strongly preferred, consideration of an equivalent combination of education and experience

Notes

This job description is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties and responsibilities of the position. Employees are held accountable for all duties of the job. Job duties and the % of time identified for any function are subject to change at any time.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Celestica’s policy on equal employment opportunity prohibits discrimination based on race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran or disability status, or other characteristics protected by law.

This policy applies to hiring, promotion, discharge, pay, fringe benefits, job training, classification, referral and other aspects of employment and also states that retaliation against a person who files a charge of discrimination, participates in a discrimination proceeding, or otherwise opposes an unlawful employment practice will not be tolerated. All information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

Location: This is a remote position, with travel as necessary. We are open to considering candidates close to any of our US locations in Massachusetts, Pennsylvania, Minnesota, Texas, Arizona, Oregon or California as well as locations near major airports such as the Northeast, Southeast, Midwest and Pacific Coast.

title: Hospital Practice Manager - Operations
description:
Description

At SCP Health, what you do matters

As part of the SCP Health team, you have an opportunity to make a difference. At our core, we work to bring hospitals and healers together in the pursuit of clinical effectiveness. With a portfolio of over 8 million patients, 7500 providers, 30 states, and 400 healthcare facilities, SCP Health is a leader in clinical practice management spanning the entire continuum of care, including emergency medicine, hospital medicine, wellness, telemedicine, intensive care, and ambulatory care.

Why You Will Love Working Here

Strong track record of providing excellent work/life balanceComprehensive benefits package and competitive compensationCommitment to fostering an inclusive culture of belonging and empowerment through our core values - collaboration, courage, agility, and respect.

What You'll Be Doing

Practice Manager- Operations is responsible for managing and supervising the Hospital Practice Specialist (PSs) and Hospital Records Coordinators. PM-Operations provide support to Hospital Medicine and Critical Care practices and are responsible for developing and improving daily processes, routines, and systems. PM-Operations is the first line of leadership responsible for resolving onboarding and overarching operational challenges/issues interfering with completion of duties by HRCs, HPSs, and clinicians. PM-Operations will reinforce compliance with data accuracy & integrity and support practice goals and targets including timely completion of practice operations. PM-Operations function as liaison between HPSs and HRCs for all interdepartmental task and processes. PM-Operations support all program starts and provide onboarding training as needed.

Day to day contact with Hospital Practice Specialist/Hospital Records Coordinators to monitor data accuracy/ integrity and trouble shoot issues interfering with completion of daily duties by HPSs, HPCs, and/or clinicians.Recruiting, training, onboarding, and leading teams and programs as assigned. Promoting strategic professional growth for both their roles and their teams.Maintaining a safe, secure, and legal work environment.Clearly articulating and evaluating job and performance expectations to their respective teams. Provide coaching, counseling, and disciplinary action to supervised employees.Developing, coordinating, auditing, and enforcing systems, policies, procedures, processes, and productivity standards.Maintains quality service by enforcing quality and customer service standards. Working diligently to resolve quality and customer service issues, mitigating deficiencies, identifying trends, and recommending system/process improvements.Assist with credentialing, scheduling/coverage emergencies as needed, facilitating conversations between staffing operations, field operations, and medical leadership.Review or assist with gathering information and standing reports needed by field operations and/or hospital partners.Support interdisciplinary teams, both SCP and hospital based, to assist with complete medical records process management, Information Systems, and Quality & Case Management priorities.Ensure PCs and PSs meet all internal and external customers needs and foster quality relationships.Support PCs and PSs for all necessary meetings and workgroups.Assist in program marketing to Medical Staff Physician Practices to ensure retention of existing referral sources and to grow new referrals and volumes.Assist with oversight and enforcement of Provider and HPC compliance as related to coding & auditing processes. Recommend re-allocation of resources across facilities to ensure requirements are met and documentation needed by auditors is available/received.Serve as back up to HPCs during unexpected or planned absences by traveling to sites and/or completing duties remotely.Responsible for completion of assigned start-up activities prior to first date of practice for new facilities.Completes initial on-site visit to ensure first phase of HPC orientation is completed and that all software, connections or other needs to complete duties are working properly on or prior to new practice engagement. Return as requested by Director or CSVP/SVP as needs arise.Acts as back-up to facilities/HPCs when unexpected or planned absences occur to ensure minimal client and SCP Health demands are met.Any other duties or assignments, related to Practice Management, determined by VP Clinical Operations and the needs of the business.Be available for emergency scheduling on-call rotation.

Who/What We Are Looking For

You have a Bachelor's Degree in Healthcare or related field.You have 3 years of Healthcare Practice Management experience preferred, or Office Management with supervisory responsibilities.Month end management or report generation experienceProfessional Fees billing, coding and auditing experience preferred Physician scheduling experience preferredKnowledge of Physician credentialing preferredYou have hospital staff interface and understanding of department functions (Case Management, Medical Records, Nursing, Medical Staff) You must be able to set priorities and demonstrate sound judgment in handling problems.You must be well organized and demonstrate exceptional time management and priority setting skills.You must be able to communicate effectively with management, staff, client hospitals and other professionals.This position will be ON-SITE, full-time (40 hours) Monday-Friday. You must be able to travel with the possibility of extended overnight stays as needed.You must have a dependable automobile for use of travel to assigned client practices.You have an understanding of Hospitalist Recruitment, Retention, Scheduling & Credentialing

title: Container Shop Welder
description:
About The Company

Republic Services, Inc. (NYSE: RSG) is a leader in the environmental services industry. We provide customers with the most complete set of products and services, including recycling, waste, special waste, hazardous waste and field services. Our industry-leading commitments to advance circularity and support decarbonization are helping deliver on our vision to partner with customers to create a more sustainable world.

In 2023, Republic’s total company revenue was $14.9 billion, and adjusted EBITDA was $4.4 billion. We serve 13 million customers and operate more than 1,000 locations, including collection and transfer stations, recycling and polymer centers, treatment facilities, and landfills.

Although we operate across North America, the collection, recycling, treatment, or disposal of materials is a local business, and the dynamics and opportunities differ in each market we serve. By combining local operational management with standardized business practices, we drive greater operating efficiencies across the company while maintaining day-to-day operational decisions at the local level, closest to the customer.

Our customers, including small businesses, major corporations and municipalities, want a partner with the expertise and capabilities to effectively manage their multiple recycling and waste streams. They choose Republic Services because we are committed to exceeding their expectations and helping them achieve their sustainability goals. Our 41,000 team members understand that it's not just what we do that matters, but how we do it.

Our Company Values Guide Our Daily Actions

Safe: We protect the livelihoods of our colleagues and communities.Committed to Serve: We go above and beyond to exceed our customers’ expectations.Environmentally Responsible: We take action to improve our environment.Driven: We deliver results in the right way.Human-Centered: We respect the dignity and unique potential of every person.

We are proud of our high employee engagement score of 86. We have an inclusive and diverse culture where every voice counts. In addition, our team positively impacted 4.6 million people in 2023 through the Republic Services Charitable Foundation and local community grants. These projects are designed to meet the specific needs of the communities we serve, with a focus on building sustainable neighborhoods.

STRATEGY

Republic Services’ strategy is designed to generate profitable growth. Through acquisitions and industry advancements, we safely and sustainably manage our customers’ multiple waste streams through a North American footprint of vertically integrated assets.

We focus on three areas of growth to meet the increasing needs of our customers: recycling and waste, environmental solutions and sustainability innovation.

With our integrated approach, strengthening our position in one area advances other areas of our business. For example, as we grow volume in recycling and waste, we collect additional material to bolster our circularity capabilities. And as we expand environmental solutions, we drive additional opportunities to provide these services to our existing recycling and waste customers.

Recycling and Waste

We continue to expand our recycling and waste business footprint throughout North America through organic growth and targeted acquisitions. The 13 million customers we serve and our more than 5 million pick-ups per day provide us with a distinct advantage. We aggregate materials at scale, unlocking new opportunities for advanced recycling. In addition, we are cross-selling new products and services to better meet our customers’ specific needs.

Environmental Solutions

Our comprehensive environmental solutions capabilities help customers safely manage their most technical waste streams. We are expanding both our capabilities and our geographic footprint. We see strong growth opportunities for our offerings, including PFAS remediation, an increasing customer need.

SUSTAINABILITY INNOVATION

Republic’s recent innovations to advance circularity and decarbonization demonstrate our unique ability to leverage sustainability as a platform for growth.

The Republic Services Polymer Center is the nation’s first integrated plastics recycling facility. This innovative site processes rigid plastics from our recycling centers, producing recycled materials that promote true bottle-to-bottle circularity. We also formed Blue Polymers, a joint venture with Ravago, to develop facilities that will further process plastic material from our Polymer Centers to help meet the growing demand for sustainable packaging. We are building a network of Polymer Centers and Blue Polymer facilities across North America.

We continue to advance decarbonization at our landfills. As demand for renewable energy continues to grow, we have 70 landfill gas-to-energy projects in operation and plan to expand our portfolio to 115 projects by 2028.

RECENT RECOGNITION

Barron’s 100 Most Sustainable CompaniesCDP DiscloserDow Jones Sustainability IndicesEthisphere’s World’s Most Ethical CompaniesFortune World’s Most Admired CompaniesGreat Place to WorkSustainability Yearbook S&P Global

Minimum Requirements

Minimum of 1 year welding experience OR COMPLETION OF A WELDING PROGRAM.

Rewarding Compensation And Benefits

Eligible employees can elect to participate in:

 Comprehensive medical benefits coverage, dental plans and vision coverage. Health care and dependent care spending accounts. Short- and long-term disability. Life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment insurance. Employee and Family Assistance Program (EAP). Employee discount programs. Retirement plan with a generous company match. Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP).

Furthermore, they do not establish a contract for employment and are subject to change at the discretion of the Company.

title: Mechanical Estimator
description:
Overview: As a mechanical estimator, you'll be responsible for accurately assessing and estimating the costs associated with mechanical systems for construction projects. You'll work closely with project managers, engineers, suppliers, and subcontractors to develop detailed cost estimates, ensuring that projects are completed within budgetary constraints while meeting quality standards and client requirements.
Key Responsibilities:Cost Estimation: Utilize your expertise to calculate the costs of materials, labor, equipment, and other resources required for mechanical systems such as HVAC (Heating, Ventilation, and Air Conditioning), plumbing, piping, and fire protection systems.Project Analysis: Review project specifications, blueprints, and other documentation to understand project requirements thoroughly. Analyze drawings and technical documents to identify project scope, potential risks, and opportunities for cost optimization.Vendor and Subcontractor Coordination: Collaborate with vendors and subcontractors to obtain competitive pricing for materials and services. Evaluate bids and proposals to select the most cost-effective options while maintaining quality standards.Cost Breakdowns: Prepare detailed cost breakdowns and estimates for various project components, including labor, materials, equipment rental, permits, taxes, and overhead costs.Value Engineering: Identify opportunities for value engineering to optimize project costs without compromising quality or performance. Propose alternative materials, methods, or design solutions to achieve cost savings while meeting project requirements.Risk Assessment: Identify potential risks and uncertainties that may impact project costs, schedule, or performance. Develop contingency plans and risk mitigation strategies to address potential challenges and ensure project success.Bid Preparation: Prepare comprehensive bid proposals and cost estimates for clients, incorporating all relevant project details, pricing information, and terms and conditions. Present estimates and proposals to clients and stakeholders, addressing any questions or concerns they may have.Cost Control: Monitor project costs throughout the construction process, comparing actual expenditures to budgeted estimates. Identify cost variances and deviations from the original estimate, implementing corrective actions as needed to keep the project on track financially.Documentation: Maintain accurate records of cost estimates, bid proposals, vendor/subcontractor communications, and other project-related documentation. Ensure compliance with industry standards, regulations, and company policies.
Your Background: What kind of person will thrive in this role? 
You should have… Ten years of commercial estimating or preconstruction experience within the construction industry.A track record of critical thinking and problem solving, using sound judgement to make decisions.Ability to effectively manage, train and develop employees.Experience in design/build and plan/spec delivery methods within a variety of market sectors, including commercial office, health care, hospitality, education, high-rise residential, bio-tech and government.Advanced knowledge of estimating strategies & techniques.A degree in Mechanical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Construction Management, Business, or related field.

title: Senior Director, Sourcing & Product Management
description:
At STERIS, we help our Customers create a healthier and safer world by providing innovative healthcare and life science product and service solutions around the globe.

Position Summary

This position is accountable for developing and executing global procurement strategies aligned with business needs for a multi-site sourcing and purchasing organization. Incumbent will manage existing supplier relationships, identify new sources of supply as needed, communicate regularly with senior leaders, execute joint collaborative initiatives, and lead supplier contract negotiations.

Responsible for directing and overseeing all aspects of the product life cycle management. including understanding market demands, technology trends, and the competitive landscape. Responsible for setting the strategic product roadmap, providing input to product development, establishing marketing, pricing, and launch strategies to optimize share and margin across the portfolio.

Works closely with sales, marketing and procurement to increase revenue and profitability, evaluates material and production resources supporting the product lines, and identifies market trends and needs for the global platform of products to ensure product designs are matched to customer demand.

Responsible for the development, execution and continuous analysis and improvement of effective global category sourcing strategies that result in improved KPI’s. Understands at an expert level the needs of the business, global supply chain, market environments, and technical requirements of the Customer to effectively work across functions, business units and suppliers to create strategies that mitigate supply chain risk and leverage procurement spend to meet business objectives.

Duties

Lead a multi-site global procurement organization focused on supply planning, existing vendor management, purchasing, procurement, and inbound logistics Lead Product Management function and ensure alignment between product development initiatives and sourcing strategyLead Key Surgical Marketing function to ensure alignment between marketing and sourcing strategyInterface directly with senior leadership to assure company objectives are met, including quality, service, reliability, and fulfillment.Develop, execute, and continuously analyze and improve upon global category strategies focused on the current needs and future objectives of the business. Rationalize the supply base in terms of category strategy to reduce cost and risk and improve leverage of overall procurement spend. Analyze data and/or insights to determine and anticipate global industry and market trends; use determinations to develop long-term strategies for improved portfolio performance. Anticipate, analyze and resolve complex supply challenges while maintaining effective communication with appropriate stakeholders. Identify new and develop existing supplier relationships through comprehensive supplier relationship management strategies, resulting in year-over-year improvements.Link sourcing and procurement processes to continuous improvement opportunities in planning, customer voice, and the ability to address supplier constraints and opportunities. Understand operational considerations. Identify business demand requirements and partner with leadership to support the delivery of annual value improvements ,drive competitive advantage and reduce inventoryFinancial and budget responsibility for global procurement including communicating a forecast for areas of responsibility and aligning procurement with the financial plan. Oversight and management of purchasing in Eden Prairie and LensahnOversight and management of backorder process for the Key Surgical portfolio

Required Experience

MBA or supply chain related Masters degree strongly preferred.15 years related sourcing, purchasing or procurement experienceMinimum 10 years management experienceSolid organizational and project management skills required Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite Solid working knowledge and proficiency in ERP/MRP systems; Experience and understanding of Lean Manufacturing Prior marketing experience preferredPrior supply chain/operations experience within the medical industry is a plus Demonstrated experience in drafting contracts, leading supplier negotiations and RFIs/RFPs Demonstrated collaboration and influencing skills Strong project and time management skills; demonstrated ability to prioritize multiple projects and deadlines Intimate knowledge and understanding of various procurement methods, strategic sourcing and supply chain practices & strategies Demonstrated experience in utilizing continuous improvement methods (Lean, Six Sigma, 5S) Subject matter expert within material categories, market places, indexes and trends arena Demonstrated proficiency with ERP software (Oracle strongly preferred) and Microsoft Office Suite Excellent verbal and written communication skills

title: Remote Business Analyst Resource III (Business Strategy & Applications (BSA)
description:
Job Description

Purpose & Scope: The Contractor, Business Strategy & Applications (BSA), provides analytics expertise to multiple stakeholders across the company value chain including drug development,, Medical Affairs, RX+, Patient Centricity, etc. The person executes statistical data analysis through assessment and understanding of internal datasets used by BOLDx Innovation Team, including but not limited to real-world databases (e.g, EMR, claims, etc.) across the company's entire value chain, geographic footprint, and therapeutic areas. The deliverables of the Contractor BSA require expertise in creation, quality control and maintenance of research projects and programs. The Contractor will be able to develop the methodology to address the business question presented by the internal client, conduct the analysis and relay the results. In addition, they will create project methodology, data definitions and analyses in a post-hoc manner from existing databases and will be able to collaborate with BoldX colleagues to address these issues under the direction of a BoldX colleague with statistical expertise. In addition, they must be able to run and develop statistical programs outside of the tools available.

Essential Job Responsibilities

Execute on multiple concomitant projects, including but not limited to, evidence generation using real world data, time series sales forecasting, cost estimation for trials or other related areas. Meets regularly with internal and external stakeholders to ensure mutual understanding of the project design, required output and timelines. Responsible for the statistical contribution to internal studies to support Bold X objectives. Develop and maintain R, Python, SAS/SQL programs for the creation of tables, figures, and deliverables for each project. Desired ability to program in R Shiny to enhance and maintain current tools available. Must be able to meet timelines with minimal supervision of progress. Develops programming expertise in advanced statistical. Develop data mining and/or data modeling plans to support BoldX projects and programs. Stays current on data sources and participates in supporting of PDS Strategy Team by facilitating Maintenance of custom database, correspondence with vendors, set-up of PDS vendor meetings. Provides ideas and support for further enhancements to tools, and resources currently developed or plan to be developed to drive innovation. Collaborates with Procurement, Data Science, Clinical Trials, MIPI, and the Innovation team to acquire new data and run custom analytics. Provide expertise in building in-house tools to enable rapid, high-quality execution for key routine analytics. 

Quantitative Dimensions

Deliver multiple projects within stipulated timeline and enhance analytical capability of the customers. Increase analytical efficiency. Identify new applications of existing data. Support key use cases of requests from business partners or associated functions through the analysis of OMOP’ed real world data sources. Interpret, summarize, and explain analysis results to stakeholders. Translate business needs into analytic requirements for project execution and future tool development. Collaborate with other internal resources to develop and share best practices and leverage cross-functional efficiencies. 

Organizational Context: The Contractor BSA reports to the Director, Lead of RWD Innovations. They will have multiple cross-collaborative projects and matrix responsibilities across the BoldX division. As well as help to develop, maintain, and assist in PDS Database of RWD vendors and identifying fit-for-purpose data for analytical studies.

Required Skills 

Bachelor’s degree Experience in health research analytics (HEOR, commercial analyses, and Outcome based analyses) Knowledge of coding against common real-world data types (claims and EMR) and common data models. Excellent R, Python, or SAS skills. Preferred R-Shinny skills. SQL programming skill with experience on large databases (i.e., millions of records) Must possess excellent verbal and written communication skills, attention to details, and the ability to multi-task. Excellent organizational, planning and project management skills and ability to effectively manage cross-functional projects. Ability to work independently in a dynamic fast paced environment, with minimal supervision.Preferred Masters/PhD Degree in informatics, epidemiology, or clinical discipline. An economics or applied statistics degree is acceptable if the candidate has demonstrated experience with quantitative methods in life science. 3+ years related experience with 2+ years in healthcare industry, preferably in an epidemiology/ economics/ market access research group working with Real World Data (insurance claims, EMR/ EHR) Ability to translate business questions into data analysis plan. Must be able to efficiently educate business partners on best use cases for RWD. Ability to translate business / functional needs into RWDE analytics projects. At least 1-year relevant programming experience. Preferable knowledge of at least one other statistical package (e.g., R, Python) Team player with good communication skills 
The Planet Group of Companies is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Senior Machinist
description:
Overview

Element has an opportunity for a Senior Machinist to join our rapidly expanding team in Glendale Heights IL. As a member of the operations team, this individual will report to the Operations Manager and will be responsible for machine set-ups, maintenance, repairs, programming, and development of new specimen manufacturing processes within the various departments, procedures, continuous improvement tools, cost reductions and timely delivery of items to subsequent departments. The individual must be proficient in a number of established mechanical and machining skills. In addition, compliance with safety rules, company policies and procedures is required.

Responsibilities

 Designs and performs machine sets-ups and machine programming to produce test specimens in according with consensus standards, customer specifications, internal procedures/guidance notes as well as other tools to ensure the safety, quality and effectiveness of all shop members  Select and program various machines to produce, develop and validate processes to prepare test specimens for testing as dictated by processes, customer specifications, operations manager, or engineers  Coordinates review of departmental maintenance requirements and recommendations, quality records and machine operations for indications of potential quality issues, troubleshoots problems and solves production issues with operators, including machine shop supervisor  Develops new processes, procedures and uses continuous improvement tools to improve efficiency, reduce costs and delivery of specimens to internal customers (departments) measuring with appropriate KPI’s  Reviews internal systems and business processes for effectiveness, researches and considers new approaches, identifies develops, and deploys up to date, relevant technologies to the production of test specimens  Design, repair, rework fixtures for manufacturing and testing departments 

Skills / Qualifications

 General working knowledge of machine shop safety protocols and best practices for grinding, milling, turning and waterjet machine operation, manual and computer numeric controlled (CNC) machines and mechanical test equipment.  Ability to read and understand mechanical drawings/blueprints/cut sheets and apply concepts of basic algebra, geometry and GD&T.  Operational understanding of various mechanical concepts, techniques and technologies used to produce and test prototype/specimens in a time sensitive environment.  Depth of understanding related to machining concepts, measuring instruments e.g., calipers, micrometers, optical comparators, and dimensional measuring concepts.  Must be able to work with others with minimal supervision and seek out information as necessary to clarify technical requirements from the departmental supervisors/engineers, or Operations Manager.  Possesses the ability to assist departmental supervisor in mentoring and training individuals with less experience through effective communication of mechanical and machining process and technical data.  HS diploma, GED certificate or Vocational school equivalent highly desired and/or 5-7 years of experience.  CAD software knowledge and strong computer skills.  Exemplary emotional intelligence and communication skills.  Knowledge of quality management systems (Six Sigma, 5S and Lean Manufacturing, GD&T) and ISO-9001or equivalent quality system. 

Physical Demands:

Frequency of required physical force: ModerateLifting requirements: lifting <50 lbs. often and > 50 lbs. on occasionAbility to stand on feet for long periods of timeAbility to lift 50+lbs periodically

Company Overview

Element is one of the fastest growing testing, inspection and certification businesses in the world. Globally we have more than 9,000 brilliant minds operating from 270 sites across 30 countries. Together we share an ambitious purpose to ‘Make tomorrow safer than today’.

When failure in use is not an option, we help customers make certain that their products, materials, processes and services are safe, compliant and fit for purpose. From early R&D, through complex regulatory approvals and into production, our global laboratory network of scientists, engineers, and technologists support customers to achieve assurance over product quality, sustainable outcomes, and market access.

While we are proud of our global reach, working at Element feels like being part of a smaller company. We empower you to take charge of your career, and reward excellence and integrity with growth and development.

Industries across the world depend on our care, attention to detail and the absolute accuracy of our work. The role we have to play in creating a safer world is much bigger than our organization.

 Diversity Statement 

At Element, we always take pride in putting our people first. We are an equal opportunity employer that recognizes diversity and inclusion as fundamental to our Vision of becoming “the world’s most trusted testing partner”.

All suitably qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment on the basis of objective work related criteria and without regard for the following: age, disability, ethnic origin, gender, marital status, race, religion, responsibility of dependents, sexual orientation, or gender identity or other characteristics in accordance with the applicable governing laws or other characteristics in accordance with the applicable governing laws.

title: Cardiology Business Development Representative-Seattle
description:
HeartFlow, Inc. is a medical technology company advancing the diagnosis and management of coronary artery disease, the #1 cause of death worldwide, using cutting-edge technology. The flagship product—an AI-driven, non-invasive cardiac test supported by the ACC/AHA Chest Pain Guidelines called the HeartFlow FFR CT Analysis—provides a color-coded, 3D model of a patient’s coronary arteries indicating the impact blockages have on blood flow to the heart. HeartFlow is the first AI-driven non-invasive integrated heart care solution across the CCTA pathway that helps clinicians identify stenoses in the coronary arteries (RoadMap™Analysis), assess coronary blood flow (FFR CT Analysis), and characterize and quantify coronary atherosclerosis (Plaque Analysis). Our pipeline of products is growing and so is our team; join us in helping to revolutionize precision heartcare.

HeartFlow is a VC-backed, pre-IPO company that has received international recognition for exceptional strides in healthcare innovation, is supported by medical societies around the world, cleared for use in the US, UK, Europe, Japan and Canada, and has been used for more than 250,000 patients worldwide.

The Business Development Representative (BDR) will be the face of HeartFlow within a specific geographic region. The BDR will work with customers to ensure that they are extremely successful with HeartFlow’s non-invasive cardiovascular diagnostic technology. It is your responsibility to drive adoption through the network of referring physicians. You will work with your accounts proactively to support, educate, and provide solutions to build high customer satisfaction. This is a customer- facing role with a primary focus on spending time with customers including Cardiologists, Primary Care Physicians, Nurse Practitioners, and beyond. Expect approximately 20-25% travel from a home office.

The HeartFlow analysis is a first-of-its-kind noninvasive technology that helps clinicians diagnose and treat patients with suspected coronary artery disease (CAD).

Job Responsibilities:

Will work with key strategic HeartFlow accounts to drive growth and adoption of a cCTA and FFRct clinical pathway. In these accounts, the BDR will develop and execute business development plans working closely with the account’s key stakeholdersFacilitate cross-functional collaboration throughout the organization. Tools for program development could include key deployment of HeartFlow internal leadership and physician mentors, organizing and staffing of dinner programs, VIP Visits, organizing HeartFlow CT Pathway road-shows, referring physician office meetings, etc. This role will work closely with the other HeartFlow team members to include respective DSM, Marketing, Market Access, CT Apps, Product Development and ClinicalIncrease HeartFlow usage within the designated key strategic HeartFlow account by: 1) Maintaining and building relationships with referring physicians and other key clinical stakeholders 2) Educating customers on HeartFlow’s value proposition by giving presentations / having discussions with referring MDs 3) Promoting / championing HeartFlow and building advocacProduction/Success/Achievement of the Business Development Representative will be evaluated and based on performance in active/targeted accounts(metrics): 1) Meet / exceed quota for the strategic HeartFlow account (within existing customer locations) 2) cCTA growth (conversion of non-invasive tests) and FFRct penetration / case growth over baseline (% and $) in assigned accounts.

Skills Needed:

Proven sales skills and track-record of sales achievementAccount development - Experience building and supporting strong clinical programs is preferred.Clinical / technical proficiency - Quick learner able to grasp new clinical/technical information and then disseminate to customers.Develop relationships with key account stakeholders, to include admin, admin support, key cardiologists, key referring physician practices, hospital marketing and key strategic personnel to drive awareness of a cCTA/FFRct pathway, broaden HeartFlow referrals, and deepen HeartFlow adoption.Work in a cross functional capacity to coordinate field and HQ resources needed to support focused customers and execute program development plans, support sales, marketing, education and training.Customer-focused mentality.Ability to explain medical technologies to referring physicians and health care professionals.Knowledge of cardiac patient pathways and diagnostic technology is preferred.Self-motivated and ability to initiate, organize, and complete projects.Excellent problem-solving ability, especially under pressure.Extremely strong work ethic.Works well in a cross-functional team environment.Ability to work effectively with customers from a wide range of technical and clinical backgrounds.Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Professional etiquette.Experience with Salesforce.com or similar CRM

Educational Requirements & Work Experience

4-year degree with5+years of related sales or clinical experience or 2-year degree with7+ years related sales or clinical experience.Degree in Science, Medical, Business, Marketing or Technical field is preferred.Prior experience in medical device, cardiology pharmaceuticals, cardiology radio-pharmaceuticals, hospital, or medical software is highly desiredExperience with introducing new cardiovascular technologies into hospitals is highly desired

title: Project Engineer (Pre-Sales)
description:
Enertiv is a trailblazing company in the Commercial Real Estate Technology industry, specializing in a SaaS-based connected platform that integrates hardware and software solutions to optimize building operations. Renowned for its innovative approach to enhancing the performance and health of building systems, Enertiv leverages cutting-edge IoT technology, data analytics, and real-time insights to revolutionize energy management, operational efficiency, and cost reduction in the commercial real estate sector.
